description.summary: The Algorithms plugin contains various geeky functions and algorithms.

command.name: damerau
command.summary: calculates Damerau-Levenshtein distance between two given words

command.name: levenshtein
command.summary: calculates Levenshtein distance between two given words

command.name: zh
command.summary: looks up a Mandarin word in CEDICT

command.name: zhen
command.summary: looks up an English word in CEDICT

description.summary: Provides channel resolution service and maintains various related information.
The Clock plugin tells the time.

command.name: jtime
command.summary: tells the current time in Japan only

command.name: time
command.summary: tells the current time. Optionally accepts space-separated list of timezone identifiers (e.g. Asia/Tokyo), or simply their parts after / and without spaces (e.g. 'NewYork'), timezone abbreviations (e.g. UTC, JST), and ISO-3166 country names (e.g. US, JP)

command.name: utime
command.summary: tells the current time in UTC only

command.name: chat
command.summary: sends a DCC CHAT request back to the caller

command.name: dcc_kill
command.summary: allows to show and kill DCC connections from current user. When no arguments supplied, shows connections. Accepts any of: connection number (e.g. 12345), 'current' (kills current connection), 'other' (kills all but current connection), 'all'. Example: .dcc_kill other

command.name: dcc_reg
command.summary: associates given DCC connection credentials with the current IRC user. The credentials are given out on every DCC connection attempt from user.

command.name: dcc_unreg
command.summary: disassociates given DCC connection credentials from the current IRC user. The credentials are given out on every DCC connection from user.

command.name: schat
command.summary: sends a DCC SCHAT (SSL-encrypted chat) request back to the caller

command.name: de
command.summary: looks up an English word in Daijirin

command.name: dj
command.summary: looks up a Japanese word in Daijirin

command.name: djr
command.summary: searches Japanese words matching given regexp in Daijirin. In addition to standard regexp operators (e.g. ^,$,*), special operators & and && are supported. Operator & is a way to match several regexps (e.g. 'A & B & C' will only match words, that contain all of A, B and C letters, in any order). Operator && is a way to specify separate conditions on kanji and reading (e.g. '物 && もつ'). Classes: \k (kana), \K (non-kana)

command.name: du
command.summary: Generates an url for lookup in dic.yahoo.jp

command.name: roll
command.summary: rolls the dice

command.name: e
command.summary: looks up an English word in EDICT

command.name: j
command.summary: looks up a Japanese word in EDICT

command.name: jr
command.summary: searches Japanese words matching given regexp in EDICT. In addition to standard regexp operators (e.g. ^,$,*), special operators & and && are supported. Operator & is a way to match several regexps (e.g. 'A & B & C' will only match words, that contain all of A, B and C letters, in any order). Operator && is a way to specify separate conditions on kanji and reading (e.g. '物 && もつ'). Classes: \k (kana), \K (non-kana)

command.name: jn
command.summary: looks up a Japanese word in ENAMDICT

command.name: jnr
command.summary: searches Japanese words matching given regexp in ENAMDICT. In addition to standard regexp operators (e.g. ^,$,*), special operators & and && are supported. Operator & is a way to match several regexps (e.g. 'A & B & C' will only match words, that contain all of A, B and C letters, in any order). Operator && is a way to specify separate conditions on kanji and reading (e.g. '物 && もつ'). Classes: \k (kana), \K (non-kana)

description.summary: Plugin for working with dictionaries in EPWING format.

section.name: search
section.summary: Searching is straightforward, but it's worth noting that since used EPWING library searches both English and Japanese words via the same call, no convenient input word mangling is done. In particular, text in ro-maji isn't converted to kana, you must do it yourself. You can also use .epwing command to search in all available dictionaries simultaneously.

section.name: postfix
section.summary: Search commands can (where supported by underlying dictionary) be postfixed with one of the following: ! for exact search, $ for ends-with search, @ for keyword search. No postfix is 'contains' search. ~ is the same, but doesn't substitute gaiji. The exact meaning of search modes seems to vary with dictionary, so try and find what suits you best.

section.name: gaiji
section.summary: Because EPWING dictionaries internally use JIS encodings, they can't represent lots of characters. As a workaround they use actual pictures instead, which they call 'GAIJI'. Whenever you see text like <?A2C4W?>, that's them. You can look up ASCII rendering of them using .gaiji? command. Using .gaiji command to supply unicode equivalents for gaiji is strongly encouraged.

command.name: daijirin
command.summary: looks up given word in 三省堂 スーパー大辞林. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: daijisen
command.summary: looks up given word in 大辞泉. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: daijiten5
command.summary: looks up given word in 研究社 新和英大辞典 第５版. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: daijiten6
command.summary: looks up given word in 研究社 新英和大辞典 第６版. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: eijiro
command.summary: looks up given word in 英辞郎１０３. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: epwing
command.summary: looks up given word in all opened EPWING dictionaries. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: gaiji
command.summary: supplies given replacement symbol(s) for specified gaiji in specified dictionary. See '.help EPWING gaiji' for more info. Example: .gaiji daijirin WD500 (1) <-- to add (1) as replacement for <?WD500?> in Daijirin. Example: .gaiji daijirin WD500 <-- to remove existing mapping for WD500 in Daijirin.

command.name: gaiji?
command.summary: renders in ASCII symbol for specified gaiji in specified dictionary. Use .gaiji?? and .gaiji??? for different formats. See '.help EPWING gaiji' for more info. Example: .gaiji? daijirin WD500

command.name: genius
command.summary: looks up given word in ジーニアス英和大辞典. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: kojien
command.summary: looks up given word in 広辞苑第六版. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: kotowaza
command.summary: looks up given word in 故事ことわざの辞典. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

section.name: usage
section.summary: This dictionary seems to accept only kana for search.

command.name: nihonshi
command.summary: looks up given word in 岩波日本史辞典ＣＤ‐ＲＯＭ版. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: readers
command.summary: looks up given word in 研究社リーダーズ＋プラスＶ２. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: rikagaku
command.summary: looks up given word in 理化学辞典第５版. See '.help EPWING' for more info.

command.name: help
command.summary: lists available commands or shows information about specified command or plugin

command.name: plugins
command.summary: lists the loaded plugins

command.name: k
command.summary: looks up a given kanji, or shows list of kanji satisfying given search terms, using Jim Breen's KANJIDIC2( http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~jwb/kanjidic_doc.html ), and GSF kanji list kindly provided by Con Kolivas( http://ck.kolivas.org/Japanese/entries/index.html )

section.name: terms1
section.summary: Words in meanings ('west sake'), kun-yomi stems (in hiragana), on-yomi (in katakana), pinyin ('zhun3'), korean (in hangul), stroke count ('S10')

section.name: terms2
section.summary: SKIP code ('P1-4-3' or just '1-4-3', see also .faq skip), partial SKIP code (e.g. 'P1', 'P1-4', 'P*-4', 'P*-*-3'), frequency ('F15'), GSF frequency ('FG15'), grade (from 1 to 10, e.g. 'G3'), JLPT level (from 1 to 4, e.g. 'J2'), classic radical (e.g. 'C水', or number from 1 to 214, e.g. 'C15'), or constituent parts (e.g. 'PP水')

section.name: terms3
section.summary: You can use any space-separated combination of search terms, to find kanji that satisfies them all. As a shortcut feature, you can also lookup kanji just by stroke count without S prefix (e.g. '.k 10'), if it's the only given search term

command.name: k?
command.summary: same as .k, but gives out long results as a menu keyed with radicals

command.name: kl
command.summary: gives a link to the kanji entry of the specified kanji at jisho.org

description.summary: Stores karma and other kinds of points for users.

command.name: hp
command.summary: shows how many hentai points the specified user has. You can give a user hentai points by writing their nick followed by '変態' or 'ロリコン', or take them using '紳士'

command.name: karma
command.summary: shows how many karma points the specified user has. You can give a user a karma point by writing their nick followed by '++'

command.name: lp
command.summary: shows how many language points the specified user has. +1 if a message contains Japanese, otherwise -1

command.name: kana
command.summary: converts specified romazi to kana. Use lower-case for hiragana, upper-case for katakana

command.name: load
command.summary: loads or reloads specified plugin

command.name: unload
command.summary: unloads specified plugin

description.summary: A plugin for basic bot management.

command.name: demonstrate
command.summary: accepts raw message without prefix, sends it to server and then acts as if received it in the usual way from sender. Example: .demonstrate PRIVMSG ##japanese :.help <-- prints '.help' followed by help contents, as if sender was in ##japanese and issued .help command

command.name: join
command.summary: joins specified channel(s)

command.name: kill
command.summary: kills current connection

command.name: part
command.summary: parts from specified channel(s)

command.name: raw
command.summary: sends raw text to server

command.name: raw_ctcp
command.summary: <destination> <command> [args] - sends custom CTCP PRIVMSG command to destination

description.summary: Provides access to simple associative array of text.

command.name: faq
command.summary: shows various faq entries

command.name: jmark
command.summary: shows the description of an EDICT/ENAMDICT marker

command.name: ppl
command.summary: shows descriptions of various channel people

command.name: mecab
command.summary: attempts to break up given japanese sentence into words, using MeCab morphological analyzer

command.name: n
command.summary: returns the next list of menu entries. Given a number, shows the list of entries starting from that position

command.name: u
command.summary: goes up in hierarchy of entries

command.name: m
command.summary: returns a mnemonic for the specified character

command.name: ns
command.summary: spells out the specified number

description.summary: Provides inter-plugin message delivery and filtering.

command.name: acl
command.summary: Bot access list and routing commands

section.name: ban
section.summary: denies access to the bot to any user, whose 'nick!ident@host' matches given mask. This command works only in private and only for bot operators

section.name: unban
section.summary: removes existing ban rule or adds ban exception. This command works only in private and only for bot operators

section.name: show
section.summary: shows currently effective access list. This command works only in private and only for bot operators

section.name: test
section.summary: matches given 'nick!ident@host' against access lists. This command works only in private and only for bot operators

section.name: op
section.summary: applies +o to calling user on current channel. This command works only for bot operators

section.name: deop
section.summary: applies -o to calling user on current channel. This command works only for bot operators

description.summary: A plugin that keeps track of when a user was last seen and where.

command.name: seen
command.summary: [nick] - gives information on when [nick] was last seen. Example: .seen K5

command.name: seenwhile
command.summary: [text] - specifies additional text to show whenever someone uses .seen command on you. Example: .seenwhile drinking beer

description.summary: A plugin that keeps track of various statistics.

command.name: about
command.summary: shows short description of this bot

command.name: uptime
command.summary: shows how long the bot has been running

command.name: version
command.summary: shows the current bot version

description.summary: Provides persistent storage in YAML format for other plugins.
A plugin that can pass messages between users.

command.name: tell
command.summary: [nick] [message] (ex.: !tell K5 I will be back later) sends [message] to [nick] when he/she/it says something the next time

description.summary: Uses translation engines to translate between languages.

command.name: ce
command.summary: translates specified text from Simplified Chinese to English using Honyaku

command.name: cj
command.summary: translates specified text from Simplified Chinese to Japanese using Honyaku

command.name: ck
command.summary: translates specified text from Simplified Chinese to Korean using Honyaku

command.name: ec
command.summary: translates specified text from English to Simplified Chinese using Honyaku

command.name: ej
command.summary: translates specified text from English to Japanese using Honyaku

command.name: ek
command.summary: translates specified text from English to Korean using Honyaku

command.name: g_
command.summary: "g<from><to>" translates specified text using Google. Possible values for <from> and <to> are: _, en, ja, ko, fr, pt, de, it, es, no, ru, fi, hu, sv, da, pl, lt, nl, sw, zh, tw

command.name: gt
command.summary: attempts to guess desired translation direction for specified text and translates it using Google

command.name: h_
command.summary: "h<from><to>" translates specified text using Honyaku. Possible values for <from> and <to> are: en, ja, ko, fr, pt, zh, de, it, es

command.name: ht
command.summary: attempts to guess desired translation direction for specified text and translates it using Honyaku

command.name: jc
command.summary: translates specified text from Japanese to Simplified Chinese using Honyaku

command.name: je
command.summary: translates specified text from Japanese to English using Honyaku

command.name: jk
command.summary: translates specified text from Japanese to Korean using Honyaku

command.name: kc
command.summary: translates specified text from Korean to Simplified Chinese using Honyaku

command.name: ke
command.summary: translates specified text from Korean to English using Honyaku

command.name: kj
command.summary: translates specified text from Korean to Japanese using Honyaku

command.name: langs
command.summary: shows languages supported by this plugin (note that not all of them are available for all translation engines)

command.name: t
command.summary: is a shortcut for 'ht' command

command.name: x_
command.summary: "x<from><to>" translates specified text using Excite. Possible values for <from> and <to> are: en, ja

command.name: xt
command.summary: attempts to guess desired translation direction for specified text and translates it using Excite

command.name: short
command.summary: shortens a previously seen URL with goo.gl. This command can accept either index (1 is the most recent one) or substring of the desired URL

description.summary: A plugin that counts and manages Unicode statistics.

command.name: u?
command.summary: classify given text by Unicode ranges

command.name: u??
command.summary: output Unicode codepoints in hexadecimal for given text

command.name: urank
command.summary: shows user's ranks with respect to other users, as determined by the number of characters written per Unicode range

command.name: urank%
command.summary: same as .urank, but the percentages as returned by .us% are compared instead

command.name: us
command.summary: shows Unicode statistics: number of characters per Unicode range written by the specified user

command.name: us%
command.summary: same as .us, but shows percentage ratio to the total number of characters written by the user

command.name: utop
command.summary: shows top 10 users, as determined by the number of characters written per specified Unicode range

command.name: utop%
command.summary: same as .utop, but the percentages as returned by .us% are compared instead

command.name: uu
command.summary: output Unicode description urls for given text

description.summary: Provides access to data from various web sites

command.name: gogen
command.summary: searches gogen-allguide.com for given word etymology. Warning: it gives out only the first 24 results

description.summary: a plugin for working with WolframAlpha.

command.name: wa
command.summary: queries WolframAlpha

command.name: cn
command.summary: looks up a Cantonese word in YEDICT
